From retinol capsules to redness-reducing cream, these affordable luxuries are sure to level up your skincare game. 1. Peach Slices Redness Relief Color Correcting Cream for those days when your skin seems to be pitching a fit about one thing or another. This not only provides soothing, moisturizing ingredients like aloe and green algae, but it also has a subtle color-correcting tint that tones down redness. Think of it as a little tube of damage control for when your skin needs extra TLC. Promising review: "I'm not one to normally leave reviews, but this is worth it. I've literally had this product for two days. I have severe rosacea on my nose. It's so bad I usually have to wear foundation to hide it because it's so noticeable. I've tried numerous products and serums with no luck, and honestly, I didn't expect this one to be any different. However, after only two days (probably applying it 4–5 times), almost all of the redness is gone! I'm in disbelief at the wonders it has done. I will without a doubt be stocking up on this product!" —Tiffany Price: $19.88 2. Neutrogena Collagen Bank Facial Moisturizer that's basically an investment in your future face. Collagen can help keep things pinchably plump, bouncy, and glowy, which is great. But the real power player in this cream is the bakuchiol — an active ingredient which can boost cell turnover and smooth skin texture — which is basically retinol's less dramatic cousin. No joke, this study suggests that bakuchiol is just as effective as retinol while being way less likely to cause irritation. So basically, you get all the glow with none of the drama. It's a win-win. Promising review: "The Neutrogena Collagen Bank moisturizer is making my skin feel smoother. It does not irritate my skin, and I really like the dispenser. I plan to keep using it." —Serendipity Price: $22.97 3. Aquaphor Lip Repair Ointment to rescue your lips when they feel like they've survived a beating. With a powerhouse blend of shea butter, beeswax, vitamin E, and chamomile, this ultra-soothing balm helps restore moisture, calms irritation, and keeps flakes at bay. Stop peeling and start slathering. Promising review: "This product is highly recommended for maintaining moisture or replenishing moisture to chapped lips. I have sold lip conditioners that were 20 bucks. No need to pay that much money. Use this!" —Tina Price: $8.36 for two 4. Or NYX Professional Makeup Fat Oil for a hydration boost that also gives your lips a juicy shine. With lots of moisturizing and antioxidant-rich ingredients, this lip oil is protective, long-lasting, and nonsticky. The gorg hint of color and lovely scent are just icing on the cake. Promising review: "Lovely consistency. Not too sticky. Very hydrating. Smell is pleasant and not overpowering. A fraction of the price of the Dior lip oil." —Amy Price: $8.22+ (available in 14 shades) 5. Honest Glow On Body Oil, which is marketed to pregnant people, but hear me out!!!...

SPR_COMBO[id]Liputan6.com, Jakarta - Jisoo jadi pusat perhatian ketika mengenakan setelan merah muda pada malam kedua tur BLACKPINK Deadline Tour di Los Angeles, Amerika Serikat (AS).  Busananya terdiri dari bra cropped dan rok mini yang seluruhnya terbuat dari sutra. Ini bukan sembarang mode karena menandai debut rancangan Jonathan Anderson, direktur kreatif baru Dior.  Melansir Marie Claire, Kamis, 17 Juli 2025, Anderson dan tim menghabiskan waktu lebih dari 100 jam untuk membuatnya, karena mereka melipat setiap bahan untuk rok dengan tangan. Satu bagian rok ini dibuat tetap datar, sebuah gambaran yang jelas dari sudut pandang Anderson yang tidak biasa terhadap bentuk klasik. Foto-foto di balik layar memperlihatkan rok pannier hoop di atas salah satu pinggul, sementara yang lain dibiarkan tanpa rok dalam. Atasan bertali spageti Jisoo BLACKPINK tampak sangat cantik, dengan pita tebal di atas satin monokrom. Namun, Anderson sedikit memiringkan pita tersebut, mirip dengan bagaimana ia melapisi dasi jas di atas kerah yang tersorot pada koleksi busana pria Spring 2026. Untuk bagian aksesori, Jisoo menambahkan sentuhan grunge pada pakaian femininnya dengan sepatu bot setinggi lutut dari studio Prancis dengan harga 2,2 ribu dolar AS (sekitar Rp35 juta). Sepatu ini terbuat dari kulit mengkilap dan memiliki tumit tebal, cocok untuk menunjang penampilan panggung idola berusia 30 tahun tersebut. Pemilik nama Kim Jisoo ini jadi duta global Dior untuk mode dan kecantikan pada Maret 2021. Sejak itu, ia dikenal sebagai "Human Dior" karena sering mengenakan barang label tersebut. Hubungannya dengan Dior tampaknya tetap kuat di era Anderson, dengan Jisoo menulis di unggahan Instagram-nya, baru-baru ini, "Tidak sabar untuk mengenakan lebih banyak gaya." Pelantun lagu FLOWER ini tidak pernah melewatkan pesta Dior selama masa jabatan mantan direktur kreatif Maria Grazia Chiuri. Ia telah menghadiri setiap peragaan busana sejak September 2021, sambil membintangi berbagai kampanye mode dan kecantikan. Baru-baru ini, Jisoo mengamankan tempat duduk di barisan depan untuk presentasi Dior Fall/Winter 2025. Sebelum pertunjukan, ia melambaikan tangan pada para penggemar, mengenakan blus putih berkorset, rok hitam berenda, dan sepatu bot bertali. Jisoo memiliki tas D-Journey, D-Motion, dan D-Vibe, tapi saat itu, ia membawa tas Lady Dior yang langka. Jisoo adalah penggemar berat Dior seumur hidup, terlepas dari siapa yang memimpin. Ia kemungkinan besar sudah mengonfirmasi kehadirannya di peragaan busana wanita perdana Anderson pada Oktober 2025. Tampilan Jisoo di panggung baru-baru ini menggenapi kebahagiaan BLINK, sebutan penggemar grup tersebut. Setelah penantian yang terasa seperti selamanya, keempat personel BLACKPINK akhirnya kembali beraktivitas sebagai grup. Ini bukan sekadar konser comeback biasa. Mengutip Times of India, Jumat (18/7/2025), BLACKPINK merupakan girl group K-pop pertama yang tampil di Stadion Goyang, Korea Selatan, dengan 78 ribu penggemar hadir selama dua malam pertunjukan. Jumlah ini mencetak rekor jumlah penonton terbanyak yang pernah dicapai artis K-pop mana pun. Jumlah itu lebih banyak daripada jumlah penonton di beberapa kota. Tiga hari setelah konser, tepatnya pada 8 Juli 2025, Jisoo membagikan perasaannya di media sosial. Ia menulis, "Terima kasih pada semua BLINK dan semua yang telah bergabung dengan kami untuk menyambut awal musim panas yang hangat! Tur Dunia DEADLINE Dimulai!! Kami kembali!" Namun, yang benar-benar menyentuh hati semua orang adalah pesan spesialnya untuk para penggemar di seluruh dunia. Foto-foto yang dipublikasikannya adalah potret yang membuat penggemar bahagia, seperti  momen di panggung, foto candid di ruang ganti, dan foto-foto panggung epik yang membuat Anda ingin berada di sana. Dari gaun mini uniknya yang bertali hingga busana panggung yang anggun, Jisoo menampilkan penampilan yang sangat baik. Namun, yang paling tersorot publik adalah betapa tulusnya senyumannya di setiap foto. Hal ini membuat Anda benar-benar bisa merasakan kebahagiaan terpancar melalui layar.

SPR_COMBO[it]Le Wet Leg festeggiano il secondo disco al Numero 1 della loro carriera. “Moisturizer”, nuovo lavoro della band dell'Isola di Wight, replica il successo dell'omonimo esordio del 2022 conquistando la vetta della Official Albums Chart. Nel frattempo, l'effetto nostalgia spinge gli Oasis in Top 5 con ben tre titoli: Time Flies… 1994-2009 (3), (What's The Story) Morning Glory? (4) e Definitely Maybe (5), complice la serie di concerti-evento dei fratelli Gallagher a Heaton Park. Debutto al numero 4 per SWAG, il nuovo album a sorpresa di Justin Bieber, che segna la sua settima presenza in Top 10 nel Regno Unito. Quinta volta in classifica anche per Burna Boy: No Sign Of Weakness entra al sesto posto, confermando il momento positivo del musicista nigeriano. Tra le novità, Amy Macdonald conquista l'ottava posizione con Is This What You've Been Waiting For? , miglior piazzamento dal 2017, mentre Barry Can't Swim entra per la prima volta in Top 10 con Loner (10). Resiste in classifica Elton John: la raccolta Diamonds supera le 400 settimane nella Top 100, confermandosi una presenza costante. Clicca per la top ten album uk SINGOLI Prosegue la corsa di Dior in vetta alla classifica britannica: il brano firmato dal producer MK e dalla cantante di Manchester Chrystal conquista la sua seconda settimana consecutiva al Numero 1, confermandosi anche il brano più ascoltato nel Regno Unito con 5,5 milioni di stream in sette giorni. Alle loro spalle resiste al secondo posto Manchild, l'ex numero uno di Sabrina Carpenter, mentre Blessings, la collaborazione tra Calvin Harris e Clementine Douglas, guadagna tre posizioni e raggiunge un nuovo picco al terzo posto. La novità più alta della settimana arriva da Justin Bieber: Daisies, estratto dall'album a sorpresa Swag, entra direttamente al numero 4. Clicca per la top ten singoli uk VINILI “Moisturizer” delle Wet Leg è anche il disco è anche il più venduto nei negozi indipendenti e in formato vinile nel Regno Unito.

lola.tung, star of amazonprime's hit TV show thesummeriturnedpretty, has been busy promoting the series in New York City, showcasing a series of stylish, chic looks. Look One: For her appearance on fallontonight Show Starring Jimmy Fallon, she wore a sleek grey vintage bodycon dress from dior, featuring contrast stitch detailing and buckle straps. She completed the look with a black mini Lady Dior bag and white pointed pumps with a black diagonal strap, both by Dior. Look Two: For The Today Show, she opted for another vintage piece (both Look One and Look Two were sourced from therealreal), this time from stellamccartney. The look featured a double-breasted, military-style denim jacket with a high collar, puffed sleeves, and silver buttons, paired with a matching fitted pencil skirt. She finished the ensemble with glossy animal print pumps and double-bagged with a katespade Duo Crossbody and Liv Downtown Shoulder Bag. Look Three: At The Summer I Turned Pretty Season 3 premiere in NYC, she looked boho-chic in an ivory Tanit Turtleneck semi-sheer mini dress from the anndemeulemeester_official SS25 RTW collection. She styled it with tall, lace-up metallic sneaker boots and a coordinating lace headpiece also from the brand. SPR_COMBO[zh]这是7月下半旬的一个周五傍晚，正是芝加哥最好的时候：不是超过半年的寒冬，也没有高达35度的炙烤。 游艇和货船在河面上川流不息，但庭院中仍是沉静的一片翠绿。 穿着雪白制服的服务生单手顶着盘子迎来送往，戴着墨镜穿着Business Casual背着Hermes/Dior的男男女女时而啜一口鸡尾酒谈笑风生。 从人均冲锋衣瑜伽裤的西雅图飞回来，在一群金融人/老钱中我就是个怪物🤣
我们俩点了一个Bone-in Prime Rib(32oz)，熟度为Medium，配了Truffled Scalloped Potato，甜品点了一份巧克力蛋糕。 首先值得一提的是，我以为这家店只是纯粹的价格贵，没想到它每道菜份量巨大……图片均是服务员均分给两个人后的一人份，我们两个人都得到了相当于平时意大利菜一份甜品的量。 建议大家要不找多点人一起吃，要不少点些，我们吃到最后撑/腻死了都没吃完
其次服务对得起价格，倒水小哥加水兢兢业业而且每次都满上[笑哭R]专门负责这桌的大哥随叫随到但不会烦你。 餐前用一套餐具，吃主菜用一套餐具，吃完后上甜品前再次收拾桌子&换叉子。 上主菜的场面隆重到让我们俩有点坐立不安：5+人在我们旁边支起小桌子，像做手术一样速度巨快地把我们的牛排和配菜平分成两份（我心笑：感谢你对女性的尊重但我绝对要再次转移给🧑🏻‍🦱）
Bone-in Prime Rib：应该算是招牌菜。 他不是那种常规的煎牛排，而是低温慢烤的，所以口感与其说像牛排，更像是烤/炖牛肉，非常软烂。 我们点的Medium，服务员说烤出来差不多就是这样了，图片比实际上看起来显得更红，但其实我们觉得刚刚好，感觉再熟就会柴了。 总而言之牛肉口感不错，肥瘦相间，尤其是骨头上的肉更是软糯，如果不是为了体面我恨不得抓起来直接啃[捂嘴笑R]不过缺点就是没有煎牛排那种爆汁的口感和香气，口味也比较淡，配的汁和酱也没有起什么作用[呃R]
Truffled Scalloped Potatl：土豆片培根芝士馅饼，有松露的香气，份量大但是好咸，也有点腻，🧑🏻‍🦱根本没吃几口，有点后悔[尬住R]
巧克力蛋糕：吃累了🈚️图，作为巧克力蛋糕他肯定算是很不错的，顶上一层脆香米丰富口感，蛋糕体非常湿润浓郁，配的草莓和果酱也非常解腻。 总结：这家在dt核心，坐拥芝加哥河景，服务态度巨好，虽然菜不能算顶级，但是体验芝加哥风情是一个不错的选择！ #芝加哥美食

Totally fake, emotionally devastating — here's how I imagine AJLT wraps up. RIP Matilda. SCENE 24 – EXT. AIDAN'S FARM – MID-MORNING CARRIE arrives back at the farm in even higher heels than last time. She's dragging a soft pink weekender bag and wearing the gingham whale bonnet. She waves and starts down the narrow guesthouse stairs. A heel SNAPS. She lunges forward — arms windmilling — and lands squarely on: MATILDA, Aidan's beloved hen. The stiletto drives into MATILDA'S neck with surgical precision. Blood spatters across CARRIE'S bonnet and her Khaite Mallory maxi trench. WYATT, AIDAN, and KATHY watch as MATILDA bleeds out. WYATT screams. KATHY drops her travel mug. MATILDA convulses once. Then dies. Beat. AIDAN (quietly) You killed Matilda. CARRIE (looking at her heel, dazed) She ran into me. AIDAN (sobbing) We're done. He buys CARRIE a one-way Greyhound ticket to Port Authority — on her Amex. SCENE 25 – EXT. HANDSOME POND ROAD – LATER CARRIE waits four hours for the bus. She stands alone, the bloody bonnet flapping softly in the wind. SCENE 26 – INT. GREYHOUND BUS – MOVING – LATER CARRIE boards, sighs wistfully, and opens Amazon. As they pass through Newark, she orders ten more packs of faux Wisteria to hang over the Gramercy ironwork — “for closure.” SCENE 27 – INT. CARRIE'S APARTMENT – EARLY EVENING CARRIE sits at her vintage mid century dining table — Aidan's parting gift. She pecks out the final sentences of The Woman on handmade 19th-century paper, fed through a restored Remington No. 2 typewriter. She's still wearing the blood-soaked bonnet. It's her Jackie Kennedy moment. Nearby, a bottle of Mexican Coke sweats gently on the windowsill. The keys click rhythmically. The light is golden. She types: “The woman understood that love isn't linear. It's a loop. Like a bonnet ribbon. Or a delivery route.” DOORBELL rings. MIRANDA ENTERS, breathless. MIRANDA What the hell happened? CARRIE (Not looking up) Not that you can grasp anything about my life, Miranda, but I completely understand Aidan's decision to dump me. (She points to the bonnet) I killed his prize hen. You can go now....

SPR_COMBO[pt]Porque as mulheres usam produtos de higiene pessoal cheirosos. Enquanto os homens compram qualquer sabonete barato e shampoo com foto de jogador de futebol... Mas a real é que tem poucos produtos do tipo no Brasil. Mas fiz uma lista com alguns. Os mais baratos são os da [Natura](https://www.natura.com.br/c/homem) e da [Boticario](https://www.boticario.com.br/produtos-masculinos/). A Granado também tem produtos masculinos, mas não gosto muito do cheiro. Também tem Giorno Bagno, mas nunca usei. Um pouco mais caro, tem a [Loccitane](https://br.loccitane.com/pt-br/homem.html)*, a* [*linha 1922 da Keune*](https://www.keune.com.br/linha-1922), [Kérastase Homme](https://www.kerastase.com.br/produtos/colecoes/genesis-homme/)*, ~~Redken Brews~~ (não tem mais), ~~Jack Black~~ (tb não tem mais) e ~~Aesop~~ (mais uma que foi embora do país). Agora, se tu quer ter cheiro de rico, tem os produtos da [Le Labo](https://www.lelabofragrances.com/) (loja no shopping Iguatemy em SP), o sabonete líquido [Dior Sauvage](https://shop.dior.com.br/sauvage-shower-gel/p)*, os produtos de barba [Acqua Di parma Barbiere](https://www.sephora.com.br/search/? q=acqua+di+parma+barbiere), etc. Mas até para esse segmento tem pouquíssimas opções sendo vendida no Brasil. * Acho mais seguro comprar num marketplace (amazon, belezanaweb, amobeleza, sephora, etc) do que nessas lojas, supostamente, oficiais.

I was told I'm a neutral but I know that I'm olive leaning cool since I don't look good in any warm tones or gold. The workers were really nice but gave me the following shade suggestions, Haus lab 110 Dior 1W backstage Dior glow 1W Dior matte 1n Dior matte 1W Mont Blanc. (Seven shades in total) I went and pick up Gobi by myself which ended being the best match. I was told several times as a professional makeup artist and for a second I thought maybe I'm not olive and just neutral but I went home and in natural sunlight and I was green as a hulk😭😭😭 I asked to have it match to my chest and the rest of my body because my face is more dull and the darkest of my body alongside my neck so I didn't want my neck and head to be dark and my body be all light. Any suggestions on shade match, I'm too scared to go back 😭😭😭😭😭 I promise it may not seem like my arms are that olive but I'm pale olive for sure I'm so green it's not funny anymore

It has been a busy year for the luxury world. Arguably, it has been an even busier year for me. While I am still processing this life parenthesis, it is time to get this blog back on track. Indeed, I took the decision to carve more time to go back to what I like most: art and fashion. To start off this come back, I want to discuss the arrival of Jonathan Anderson at Dior. In early June, JWA was confirmed at the helm of one of my favorite luxury houses. This applies to both men and women. Kim Jones (formerly doing Dior Men) and Maria Grazia Chiuri (Women) will be missed, and I cannot wait for their future endeavors. Similarly, JWA will be dearly missed at Loewe which skyrocketed both culturally and commercially under his leadership. Let's see what the future holds for the Madrid Maison. Hôtel des Invalides, Courtesy Dior JWA is not new to the intersection of art and fashion. He collaborated with numerous contemporary artists while at Loewe: Lara Favaretto, Lynda Benglis or Anthea Hamilton are among my favorites. He gave them a stage. But this time, his approach is slightly different. At Loewe, Anderson had almost a cultural blank state in terms of references beyond the house codes. This was despite Loewe being the oldest fashion house of the LVMH group. But Dior comes with a rich history and cultural capital. A series of star designers before him have built on this. And in fact, the fashion, the communication, and the staging of the Men's show were about inspirations and references, not getting contemporary artists under the spotlight. « When I thought about how to expand the horizons of the Maison, I thought about Christian Dior, whom, after the Second World War, looked back to the past to create the New Look » said Anderson. Yet, the subversiveness of JWA's style transpires in the designs, showing his willingness to bridge tradition and modernity. Dior Men by Jonathan Anderson, Courtesy Numéro Magazine The fashion is where this tension is the most prominent. The Dior Delft dress and its folds inspired a wide androgynous pair of shorts. The collars on straight shirts were purposely crooked while perfectly ironed. Ties were mixed with Canadian tuxedos. Delicate flowers adorned heavy Irish-inspired knits. Bows and jellyfish-leather shoes flirted and traditional tailcoats cohabited with chunky sneakers. Soft pinks and grey hues, among Mr. Dior's signature colors, sprinkled the looks through the show. References to traditional inspirations went beyond the house of Dior with tote bags referencing Dracula by Bram Stocker (1897), Les Liaisons dangereuses by Pierre Choderlos de Laclos (1782), Bonjour tristesse by Françoise Sagan (1954) and a sentence Dior by Dior. Maybe a wink at the storytelling abilities of a designer who was as much of an artist as a publicist. Jean-Michel Basquiat by Andy Warhol, 1982, © Estate of Jean-Michel Basquiat. Licensed by Artestar, New York © 2025 The Andy Warhol Foundation for the Visual Arts, Inc. / Licensed by Artists Rights Society (ARS), New York. Lee Radziwill by Andy Warhol, 1972, © ANDY WARHOL – LA FONDATION ANDY WARHOL POUR LES ARTS VISUELS – COURTESY OF HEATHER JAMES FINE ART The totes were also among the first communication assets shared by Dior on social media. They encapsulate this dance between conceited tradition and unstructured modernity. Established as a Maison icon under Maria Grazia Chiuri, the recent success of the piece is anchored in time with references from before its creation. Similarly, the pictures of Jean-Michel Basquiat and Lee Radziwill by Andy Warhol for the first campaign, embody this challenge of bridging worlds. « Wearing Dior is being stylish. That is why I chose portraits of Jean-Michel Basquiat and Lee Radziwill. They do not have anything in common, came from completely different backgrounds. But they had style. » Finally, the location and setup of the show was expertly crafted. It played on the weight of traditional references at the brink of being challenged and remodeled. The venue was staged in front of the Invalides, a symbol of French military. It displayed a large replica of Dior's Salon Avenue Montaigne where all of Dior's shows took place. The cultural simulacrum was reinforced as guests entered the venue. The walls were adorned in grey velvet and golden wooden floor. This setup replicated a room from the Gemäldegalerie of Berlin known for best enhancing the colors of the paintings. Le Panier de Fraises, Jean Siméon Chardin, 1761, Courtesy Louvre Le Vase de Fleurs, Jean Siméon Chardin, 1760-1765, Courtesy Dior Show Venue, Courtesy Dior Show Venue, Courtesy Dior The space also welcomed two paintings effectively transforming it into a museum. The works were still lives from Jean Siméon Chardin (1699-1779). One of them, Le Panier de fraises, was borrowed from the Louvre (of which LVMH is a sponsor)....

Here are five standout digital marketing campaigns from late June–early July 2025 that are pushing creative and tech-driven boundaries 1️⃣ Apple's F1 Movie Ecosystem Launch Apple went all-in with F1 The Movie—activating iPhone alerts, haptic trailers on Apple TV, in-store events, and a full WWDC tie-in. A true omnichannel experience that merged storytelling with tech. 2️⃣ Luxury Brands in Your DMs Louis Vuitton, Dior, Margiela and more are creating exclusivity by sliding into influencers' DMs and sharing previews via Close Friends Stories. Intimacy = loyalty. 3️⃣ Channel 4's AI-Powered Ad Studio The UK broadcaster now lets small brands build full streaming ads using AI. It's fast, scalable, and creative—with compliance baked in. Democratizing digital video 4️⃣ Nostalgia-Led Campaigns at Cannes Brands like Instacart are tapping into retro vibes to emotionally connect with Gen Z and Millennials. Data + emotion = magic. ✨ 5️⃣ Beauty Brands Plan Holidays with AI Forecasting Top beauty names are launching early holiday promos with value-driven messaging, flexible payments, and AI-based stock planning. Timing meets tech. Perfume is more than just a fragrance—it's Login Bolagila a reflection of who we are. The scent we choose says something personal and intimate. It lingers in memory, marks special moments, and even builds our identity. This is why perfume continues to play such a powerful role in people's everyday lives. The Emotional Connection to Fragrance Fragrance triggers emotion like few other things can. A single scent can transport someone back to childhood, a romantic evening, or a joyful celebration. This deep emotional tie makes perfume more than fashion—it becomes part of life's soundtrack, leaving invisible traces of memories behind wherever we go. The Enduring Power of Signature Scents Many people become known for their signature scent. Friends and loved ones begin to associate them with a particular fragrance. This habit creates continuity, giving a sense of identity that's comforting and recognizable. Signature scents often become extensions of the wearer, chosen carefully to represent mood, personality, and style. Designer Perfumes That Dominate Shelves Major designers continue to shape the fragrance world. Scents like Chanel's Coco Mademoiselle, Dior's J'adore, and Yves Saint Laurent's Mon Paris remain favorites. These perfumes combine art and luxury, offering something timeless. Their popularity proves how carefully crafted scents can transcend time and speak to multiple generations of wearers. Why Celebrity Perfumes Still Sell Celebrity perfumes bring fame and fragrance together. Pop stars and actors create scents that reflect their image and connect with fans. Ariana Grande, Rihanna, and Sarah Jessica Parker have all released successful perfumes. These products allow people to feel closer to someone they admire while also discovering scents that suit them. Scent and Season: Finding the Right Fit Different seasons call for different fragrances. Fresh, airy florals and citrus blends are perfect for spring and summer, offering lightness and energy. Autumn and winter invite deeper, spicier notes like amber, musk, and vanilla. Matching a perfume to the weather helps amplify its beauty and wearability throughout the year. The Quiet Rise of Niche Fragrances Niche perfume houses offer a more artistic approach. With small batches and unique ingredients, brands like Le Labo and Byredo appeal to those seeking individuality. These perfumes don't follow mainstream trends, which makes them feel special. They speak to people who want to wear something no one else has discovered. Bolagila and the Modern Perfume Landscape Among the growing crowd of new perfume houses, Bolagila stands out for its clean lines and elegant scents. With a focus on simplicity, balance, and refinement, Bolagila caters to those who appreciate modern luxury without excessive complexity. The brand captures a contemporary vision of elegance through its thoughtful fragrance compositions. Affordable Fragrances With Lasting Impressions Perfume doesn't have to be expensive to be beautiful. Many affordable brands offer high-quality scents at accessible prices. These options give everyone the chance to enjoy fragrance as part of daily life. Great scent experiences are available at every price point, making perfume an inclusive and joyful part of self-care. Perfume's Lasting Role in Everyday Life Perfume will always have a place in human expression. It influences mood, enhances style, and creates lasting impressions. Whether you wear a classic designer fragrance or explore new brands like Bolagila, the right scent becomes part of your personal story—a quiet, invisible companion that speaks without saying a word.

SPR_COMBO[zh-tw]年輕時買的精品包，到底能不能當作傳家寶？ Melody 就在小紅書上大方曬出自己的精品包收藏，讓粉絲們大開眼界。 雖然她坦言年輕時的穿搭常被女兒吐槽，但當鏡頭轉到包包收藏時，終於扳回一城。 現在就一起來看看，Melody 藏了哪些女兒都搶著要的經典包款！ Melody精品包牆意外曝光
Melody 被身邊工作人員突襲拍攝家中日常，沒想到三大櫃的精品包牆意外曝光，讓人忍不住驚呼她真的是資深包控！ 其中一區更是滿滿的愛馬仕橘盒堆疊如牆，讓人瞬間理解她口中「不是失心瘋，是多年收藏」這句話的分量。 當鏡頭掃過她的小包收藏時，Melody 邊笑邊喊：「真的還好啦！」 甚至還一度躲進櫃子裡避難，笑翻網友。 CHANEL 2.55包
Melody 拿出CHANEL 2.55 經典包，輕描淡寫地說：「這個應該可以吧？」 她形容這款包不但漂亮又耐看，更是一個能抵抗通膨的時尚投資品，女兒則淡定回應：「It's nice.」雖然評語平實，但從表情就知道，這包已經被悄悄放進心願清單！ 雲朵包、The Row、康康包…女兒也點名
Melody 還分享大女兒主動點名的包款，Bottega Veneta 的 POUCH 雲朵包，她特別保存全新版本，只等女兒長大來繼承。 而由「富貴花們」送的 THE ROW 水桶包，她也愛不釋手。 說到愛馬仕經典的康康包，她表示：「那時候我很喜歡，H 是法郎的，白色、酒紅、黑色都有！」 典藏色讓人驚艷。 柏金、Peekaboo、Loom 都是溫柔實用派
提到收藏中的大咖，Melody 當然也少不了愛馬仕柏金包。 她坦言以前年輕追求大包，30、35cm 的尺寸是當時流行，但現在則因為太重而少背。 反倒是像 FENDI 的 Peekaboo 她會定期檢查保養，特別喜歡它的溫柔色調。 而 Loro Piana 的 Loom 包則是她最近最滿意的選品，帆布與小牛皮的對比搭配，精緻又輕盈。 女兒點頭的 DIOR 30 Montaigne
最後一款讓女兒點頭稱讚的是 DIOR 的 30 Montaigne 白色配金扣包款，經典百搭又有現代感，Melody 滿足地表示：「大女兒應該也是蠻滿意的。」 從收藏到傳承，Melody 不僅展現了她的時尚品味，也默默為女兒準備好一整座精品寶藏牆！ 圖片來源：小紅書

Zepto co-founder Aadit Palicha last week announced the 10-minute delivery for luxury cosmetic brands-- Estée Lauder's M.A.C., The Ordinary and Clinique--on the platform. From discounted offerings to previously elusive luxury and global brands, e-commerce and quick commerce platforms are witnessing a multifold surge in beauty and skincare product sales amid soaring demand. In fact, capitalizing on this trend, Zepto co-founder Aadit Palicha last week announced the 10-minute delivery for luxury cosmetic brands-- Estée Lauder's M.A.C., The Ordinary and Clinique--on the platform. After observing a surge in demand for existing beauty brands like Maybelline, Lakmé, and Faces Canada, Mamaearth, Renee, Swiss Beauty, and SUGAR Cosmetics, Zepto decided to expand its portfolio by including luxury brands as well, to offer users a wider range of options, said Devendra Meel, Chief Business Officer at Zepto. According to a report by Bengaluru-based consultancy firm Redseer, India's beauty industry is expected to reach $34 billion by 2028, driven by rising disposable incomes, increased consumer aspirations, and the influence of social media and e-commerce. Highlighting changing consumer behaviour, Amazon Beauty, Director Siddharth Bhagat told Storyboard18 about a strong shift towards tech-enabled, trend-led and personalised experiences for the cosmetics and skincare products. He said that faster deliveries, influencer-driven discovery, and the rise of D2C and international brands are further fueling the momentum. "Amazon has witnessed a 12x growth in cosmetics due to the recent success of newly launched brands in 2025," Bhagat added. Nykaa, the pioneer in building a beauty-centric digital commerce platform, said its beauty business has grown 25 percent on a year-on-year basis, recording a revenue of Rs 7,251 crore for fiscal year 2025. Nykaa's beauty vertical includes e-commerce, physical retail, its house of brands, as well as an eB2B business. Nykaa's closest competitor, Myntra, has also ramped up its beauty segment on the platform to capitalise on the demand. Deepak Joshi, Senior Director - Category Management, Beauty and Personal Care, Myntra said the platform's dedicated 'Beauty' segment has outpaced the online beauty market by two-fold, registering more than 50 percent consistent year-on-year increase in monthly active users. "Currently, Myntra Beauty boasts more than 2,900 brands," Joshi added. 'Tier-2 demand surge' Industry experts have acknowledged that tier-2 cities have emerged as a crucial market for platforms, driving demand for both affordable and premium cosmetics and skincare products. Meel from Zepto said that while quick commerce has largely remained metro-centric, traction for beauty products has notably increased in Tier-2 cities as well. Myntra's Joshi also noted that nearly half of the beauty buyers on the platform come from tier-2 and tier-3 cities. Besides, He also mentioned that Myntra's quick commerce service, M-Now, witnessed a 1.4x spike in demand for beauty products on Mother's Day in 2025. Notably, Vishal Chaturvedi, Vice President, The Body Shop, Asia South, said that quick commerce has delivered exceptional results for the company, almost doubling its growth compared to last year. "Our specially curated selection of packed gift boxes and mini packs has seen strong sales on the quick commerce platform," Chaturvedi said. 'Rise of K-Beauty' In the competitive beauty market, digital commerce platforms have expanded their portfolio by adding luxury and premium beauty offerings, particularly Korean beauty (K-beauty) brands. According to the Amazon spokesperson, the K-Beauty category on the platform has witnessed a 75 percent year-on-year growth. According to Bhagat, K-beauty products primarily resonates with urban and digital-savvy women, aged between 20 and 35 years. "The urban women have embraced K-beauty products to a larger extent, especially from cities like Bengaluru, Mumbai, Delhi, Hyderabad and Pune". Moreover, women from tier-2 cities are also exploring the K-beauty products through trial SKUs like sheet masks and minis, he added. Bucking the trend, Bhagat said Amazon has observed that a rising cohort of male consumers are also experimenting with Korean skincare, particularly around functional solutions like cleansers, serums, and sunscreens. A range of K-beauty brands have entered into Indian market via digital commerce platforms, such as COSRX, Laneige, and Beauty of Joseon, TIRTIR, Medicube, and Skin1004. Meanwhile, Myntra said that they have witnessed a 150 percent YoY growth in K-beauty category. Beyond K-beauty, several international luxury beauty brands are also capturing Indian consumers' attention through digital channels. Nykaa has a dedicated segment, called Nykaa Luxe, which offers a wide range of cosmetics and skincare products from luxury brands such as Armani beauty, Chanel, L'Oréal Luxe, Eucerin, Dior, Tom Ford, sol de janerio, among others. The company noted that the average annual spend by its top 10% customers is $395 on premium beauty products. Following suit, other platforms like Tira and Tata CliQ have also expanded their beauty portfolios. Myntra's quick commerce venture also offers a selection of international and premium beauty brands, including YSL and Estee Lauder. A report by global consultancy firm Kearney underscored that the luxury beauty accounts for about 4 percent share of the overall beauty and personal care market. In contrast, developing Asian peers, such as Thailand, Vietnam, and Malaysia, see luxury beauty holding a 20-25 market share. However, when it comes luxury beauty market, offline stores have outpace online platforms, according to Kearney. The firm said that 70 percent of luxury beauty sales came from the offline channel in the past year. "Specialty stores, with beauty-focused multi-brand retailers such as Sephora and Nykaa, contribute to 25 percent of the luxury beauty market, followed by boutiques or standalone brand stores, such as MAC, Forest Essentials, and Dior, with 20 percent of the market," the report added.

JONATHAN ANDERSON JOINS jonathan.anderson lucaguadagninoarchive « Very excited to be working with the amazing lucaguadagninoarchive ». 조나단 앤더슨의 인스타그램 스토리 속 한 문장. 누구보다 들떠 있는 것 같은 그가 <콜 미 바이 유어 네임>, <퀴어>에 이어 루카 구아다니노 감독의 신작 코미디 드라마 영화 <아티피셜>의 제작에 함께한다. 영화는 앤드루 가필드, 쿠퍼 코치, 유리 보리소프가 출연을 확정 지었다. 과거 한 인터뷰에서 “루카와의 작업은 거절할 수 없다”라고 말한 조나단 앤더슨. 이번 디올 첫 쇼에서도 루카 구아다니노 감독과 그와 친밀한 배우들이 참석해 화제였다. 출연 소식을 알린 앤드루 가필드는 지난 로에베 2024 가을/겨울 파리 쇼에 참석한 이력이 있는 바. 스쳐 지나간 런웨이의 인연이 이번엔 루카의 영화 속에서 다시 피어나는 순간! editor KIM CHAEYEON(PUMP) indiewire jonathan.anderson warnerbros challengersmovie loewe dior
